member.name: T:UnityFx.Async.AsyncContinuationOptions
member.summary: Specifies behavior of an asynchronous opration continuation.

member.name: F:UnityFx.Async.AsyncContinuationOptions.None
member.summary: When no continuation options are specified, specifies that default behavior should be used when executing a continuation. I.e. continuation is scheduled Ð¾n the same that was active when the continuation was created.

member.name: F:UnityFx.Async.AsyncContinuationOptions.NotOnRanToCompletion
member.summary: Specifies that the continuation should not be scheduled if its antecedent ran to completion.

member.name: F:UnityFx.Async.AsyncContinuationOptions.NotOnFaulted
member.summary: Specifies that the continuation should not be scheduled if its antecedent threw an unhandled exception.

member.name: F:UnityFx.Async.AsyncContinuationOptions.NotOnCanceled
member.summary: Specifies that the continuation should not be scheduled if its antecedent was canceled.

member.name: F:UnityFx.Async.AsyncContinuationOptions.OnlyOnRanToCompletion
member.summary: Specifies that the continuation should be scheduled only if its antecedent ran to completion.

member.name: F:UnityFx.Async.AsyncContinuationOptions.OnlyOnFaulted
member.summary: Specifies that the continuation should be scheduled only if its antecedent threw an unhandled exception.

member.name: F:UnityFx.Async.AsyncContinuationOptions.OnlyOnCanceled
member.summary: Specifies that the continuation should be scheduled only if its antecedent was canceled.

member.name: F:UnityFx.Async.AsyncContinuationOptions.ExecuteSynchronously
member.summary: Specifies that the continuation should be executed synchronously. With this option specified, the continuation runs on the same thread that causes the antecedent operation to transition into its final state.

member.name: T:UnityFx.Async.AsyncCreationOptions
member.summary: Specifies flags that control optional behavior for the creation and execution of operations.

member.name: F:UnityFx.Async.AsyncCreationOptions.None
member.summary: Specifies that the default behavior should be used.

member.name: F:UnityFx.Async.AsyncCreationOptions.RunContinuationsAsynchronously
member.summary: Forces continuations added to the current operation to be executed asynchronously.

member.name: F:UnityFx.Async.AsyncCreationOptions.SuppressCancellation
member.summary: If set cancelling the operation has no effect (silently ignored).

member.name: T:UnityFx.Async.AsyncResult
member.summary: A lightweight net35-compatible asynchronous operation for Unity3d.
member.remarks: This class is the core entity of the library. In many aspects it mimics Task interface and behaviour. For example, any instance can have any number of continuations (added either explicitly via TryAddCompletionCallback call or implicitly using async/await keywords). These continuations can be invoked on a captured . The class inherits and can be used to implement Asynchronous Programming Model (APM). There are operation state accessors that can be used exactly like corresponding properties of Task. While the class implements disposing is only required if property was used.
member.seealso: How to implement the IAsyncResult design pattern

member.name: M:UnityFx.Async.AsyncResult.Start
member.summary: Transitions the operation into the state.

remarks.para: An operation may be started on once. Any attempts to schedule it a second time will result in an exception.

The is used to execute an operation that has been created by calling one of the constructors. Typically, you do this when you need to separate the operation's creation from its execution, such as when you conditionally execute operations that you've created.

member.exception: Thrown if the transition has failed.
Thrown is the operation is disposed.

member.name: T:UnityFx.Async.IAsyncOperation
member.summary: Represents the consumer side of an asynchronous operation. It is basically a disposable/hookable with status information.

member.name: P:UnityFx.Async.IAsyncOperation.Id
member.summary: Gets a unique ID for the operation instance.
member.remarks: The identifiers might be assigned on demand and do not represent the order in which operations instances were created.
member.value: Unique non-zero identifier of the operation instance.

member.name: P:UnityFx.Async.IAsyncOperation.Progress
member.summary: Gets the operation progress [0, 1].
member.remarks: Different operation implementations might provide different progress resolution. Users of this interface can expect 0 value until the operation is started and 1 when it is completed as minimum.
member.value: Progress of the operation in range [0, 1].

member.name: P:UnityFx.Async.IAsyncOperation.Status
member.summary: Gets the operation status identifier.
member.value: Identifier of the operation status.

member.name: P:UnityFx.Async.IAsyncOperation.Exception
member.summary: Gets an exception that caused the operation to end prematurely. If the operation completed successfully or has not yet thrown any exceptions, this will return .
member.remarks: Task uses a special aggregate exception for providing generic error information. The library does not allow child operations by design and this fact makes usage of aggregate exceptions a very rare case. This is why we use here.
member.value: An exception that caused the operation to end prematurely.

member.name: P:UnityFx.Async.IAsyncOperation.IsCompletedSuccessfully
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the operation completed successfully (i.e. with status).
member.value: A value indicating whether the operation completed successfully.

member.name: P:UnityFx.Async.IAsyncOperation.IsFaulted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the operation completed due to an unhandled exception (i.e. with status).
member.remarks: If is , the operation's will be equal to , and its property will be non-.
member.value: A value indicating whether the operation has failed.

member.name: P:UnityFx.Async.IAsyncOperation.IsCanceled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the operation completed due to being canceled (i.e. with status).
member.remarks: If is , the operation's will be equal to , and its property will be non-.
member.value: A value indicating whether the operation was canceled.

member.name: E:UnityFx.Async.IAsyncOperationEvents.ProgressChanged
member.summary: Raised when the operation progress is changed.
member.remarks: The event handler is invoked on a thread that registered it (if it has a attached). If the operation is already completed the event handler is called synchronously. Throwing an exception from the event handler might cause unspecified behaviour.
member.exception: Thrown if the delegate being registered is .
Thrown is the operation has been disposed.

member.name: E:UnityFx.Async.IAsyncOperationEvents.Completed
member.summary: Raised when the operation is completed.
member.remarks: The event handler is invoked on a thread that registered it (if it has a attached). If the operation is already completed the event handler is called synchronously. Throwing an exception from the event handler might cause unspecified behaviour.
member.exception: Thrown if the delegate being registered is .
Thrown is the operation has been disposed.

member.name: M:UnityFx.Async.IAsyncOperationEvents.AddCompletionCallback(System.Action{UnityFx.Async.IAsyncOperation})
member.summary: Adds a completion callback to be executed after the operation has completed. If the operation is already completed the is called synchronously.

member.name: T:UnityFx.Async.IAsyncOperation`1
member.summary: Represents the consumer side of an asynchronous operation. Extends an interface with a result value.
member.typeparam: Type of th operation result value.

member.name: P:UnityFx.Async.IAsyncOperation`1.Result
member.summary: Gets the operation result value.
member.remarks: Once the result of an operation is available, it is stored and is returned immediately on subsequent calls to the property. Unlike Tasks accessing the property does not block the calling thread ( is throws instead). Note that, if an exception occurred during the operation, or if the operation has been cancelled, the property does not return a value. Instead, attempting to access the property value throws an exception.
member.value: Result of the operation.
member.exception: Thrown if the property is accessed before operation is completed.
